page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN BARNOLDSWICK
page.content: A long time ago there used to be a railway that went through Barnoldswick from Colne to Skipton. It was closed down in September 1965. The station was knocked down and now it is a car park and part of the line is a playground. We also have a canal running through Barnoldswick but we only use that for pleasure rides. Last week a barge set on fire and the fire brigade had to go to it. We are now only served by Municipal buses. My dad has a sports car and I like it. He has to go a long way to work and he comes home at the weekend in his car.
